alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rush (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rush and southeastern Henry Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dublin, or 8 miles west of Cambridge City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Rush and southeastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Straughn and Lewisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 126 and 132. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
